Workflow

Michael Rustler

2019-01-17

Source: vignettes/workflow.Rmd
workflow.Rmd

Read Endnote XML

library(kwb.endnote)

## Path to ENDNOTE XML 
endnote_xml <- kwb.endnote::default_xml()
endnote_list <- kwb.endnote::create_endnote_list(endnote_xml)

Check Import

Use Case 1: Unclean/Clean Versions

## Original Endnote data
refs_org <- kwb.endnote::create_references_df(endnote_list)

## "Cleaned" Endnote data
refs_clean <- kwb.endnote::clean_references_df(endnote_list)

## Check both for differences
diffs_df <- kwb.endnote::check_for_differences(refs_org, refs_clean)
#> Tidying data.frame 'refs_org' and rename 'value' to 'value_refs_org'. Saving to refs_org_tidy ... ok. 
#> Tidying data.frame 'refs_clean' and rename 'value' to 'value_refs_clean'. Saving to refs_clean_tidy ... ok. 
#> Joining data.frame 'refs_org_tidy' and 'refs_clean_tidy' with cols ''rec_number', 'key'' ... ok. 
#> Identifying indices with different content for 'value_refs_org' and 'value_refs_clean' ... ok. 
#> Content has changed for 1859 indices

diffs_df %>%
  dplyr::filter(.data$key != "abstract") %>% 
  head() %>% 
  knitr::kable()
rec_number key value_refs_org value_refs_clean
239 author01 Lesjean Lesjean, Boris

232 author02 Eggert Eggert, Klaas

241 author02 Pawlowsky-Reusing Pawlowsky-Reusing, Erika

Use Case 2: Two Different Endnote Files


en_old_xml <- kwb.endnote::extdata_file("2019-01-07_KWB_documents.xml")
en_new_xml <- kwb.endnote::extdata_file("2019-01-14_KWB_documents.xml")

en_old_list <- kwb.endnote::create_endnote_list(en_old_xml)
en_new_list <- kwb.endnote::create_endnote_list(en_new_xml)

en_old_df <- kwb.endnote::create_references_df(en_old_list)
en_new_df <- kwb.endnote::create_references_df(en_new_list)

en_diffs_df <- kwb.endnote::check_for_differences(en_old_df, en_new_df)
#> Tidying data.frame 'en_old_df' and rename 'value' to 'value_en_old_df'. Saving to en_old_df_tidy ... ok. 
#> Tidying data.frame 'en_new_df' and rename 'value' to 'value_en_new_df'. Saving to en_new_df_tidy ... ok. 
#> Joining data.frame 'en_old_df_tidy' and 'en_new_df_tidy' with cols ''rec_number', 'key'' ... ok. 
#> Identifying indices with different content for 'value_en_old_df' and 'value_en_new_df' ... ok. 
#> Content has changed for 37 indices

en_diffs_df %>% 
  dplyr::filter(.data$key != "abstract") %>% 
  dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(.data$rec_number), .data$key) %>% 
  knitr::kable()
rec_number key value_en_old_df value_en_new_df
1062 author01 NA Mauch, J.

n_new_entries <- length(unique(en_diffs_df$rec_number))

In total 2 new entries where created in 2019-01-14_KWB_documents.xml compared to 2019-01-07_KWB_documents.xml which contain 37 new values.

Use Case 3: Get Hints For â€˜Author Namesâ€™


multi_cols_list <- kwb.endnote::tidy_multi_cols_list(refs_clean)

names(multi_cols_list)
#> [1] "author"           "author_secondary" "author_tecondary"
#> [4] "urls_pdf"         "keywords"


hints_author_names <- tibble::tibble(author = unique(multi_cols_list$author$value)) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(hints = kwb.endnote::give_hints_author_names(.data$author)) %>% 
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(.data$hints, pattern = "^fix_")) %>% 
  dplyr::arrange(.data$author) 
#> Generate hints for 'Author Names' ... Replacing 31 values with fix_multiple_authors_per_line ... ok. 
#> Replacing 230 values with fix_firstname_lastname_with_lastname_semicolon_firstname ... ok. 
#> Replacing 27 values with fix_author_name_by_deleting_last_semicolon ... ok. 
#> ok.


hints_author_names 
#> # A tibble: 269 x 2
#>    author             hints
